newsitem.title: USA: Artisoft cuts jobs, sees weak Q4 sales.
newsitem.headline: Artisoft cuts jobs, sees weak Q4 sales.

text.p: Artisoft Inc announced plans Friday to cut its workforce to 130 employees from 270 as part of a restructuring aimed at returning the company to profitability.
The company said in a statement it was hoping to reduce its break-even point and that the job cuts would take place by September 1.
Artisoft said net sales for its fourth quarter will be substantially below the third quarter, when it had sales of $8.45 million and a loss of $3.66 million, or $0.25 a share.
The company said it saw lower sales as a result of changes in its distribution system.

The company said it will reduce its U.S. distribution channel inventories to six weeks on hand, and its non-U.S. distribution channel inventories to 10 to 12 weeks on hand. It will do so by creating appropriate provisions for returns and accounts receivable as of the end of the quarter.
Artisoft will also close certain international sales offices over the next few months, sell its Tucson corporate headquarters and move to smaller leased offices.
The company expects to take one-time charges in the fourth quarter due to severance cost, office closures, moving and other costs associated with the restructuring.
The company also promoted Paul Thomas to president and chief operating officer. Chairman William Keiper had been acting as interim president since the resignation of Joel Kocher in November.
